repository.orgName: Staats- und Universitätsbibliothek Hamburg Carl von Ossietzky

msContents.summary: The title of the manuscript is mentioned as Uttaracampū but according to the colophon it is campūprabandha. The author of the text is veṅkaṭādhvara. According to the New Catalogus Catalogorum this text is published in Granthamālā series. The balnk folio before the guard folio at the end has some text scribbled. The colophon is not completely readabel due to wormholes hence it difficult to say which year it was written.

msItem.title: Uttaracampū (campūprabandha)
msItem.author: Veṅkaṭādhvari

filiation.p: New Catalogus Catalogorum vol. 2 pp 302. Descriptive Catalogue Of Sanskrit Manuscripts In The Adyar Library Vol V: 320 mss no-954

msItem.explicit: [28v 5] ….. vaidehimupalālayannijaguṇaiḥ siṃhāsanādhyāsitassauṃdaryai sataniṣe [28v 6] vito vijayate sāmrājyalkṣīsakhaḥ
msItem.finalRubric: vāghūlānvayasindhuśritiśraṇaḥ vidvajjanāgraślāghitānmānyāyāmiha veṅkaṭādrividuṣo maṅgambimāyāṃ gu [28v 7] ṇaiḥ saṃjāte na vidarbhalakṣmaṇakṛte caṃpuprabaṃdhe kṛtaḥ kāṇḍo veṅkaṭadhvarīya viduṣā jīyācciraṃ saptamaḥ
msItem.colophon: [29r 1] prajokva(4 letters broken due to wormeaten.) kṛṣradvitīyāyāṃ vidhyordine śeṣādrāhvayadāsena ??tticaṃpussamāpītam hariḥ oṃ [29r 2] bhāradvājāncayokṛti na veṃkaṭārryasutanuśeṣādryāhvaya dāsena granthoyaṃ likhitaḥ kramāt. hariḥ oṃ

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil letter numberals for foliation in the left margin.
supportDesc.condition: Folio have wormholes and it has damaged letters.

handNote.desc: Big wide letters, sometimes difficult to understand.

additions.desc: hariḥ oṃ is written on folio 1v.

Number 44 is written with pink color. Also a sticker with printed 44 number and 64 is written with blue pen. Some text in granth script is written on the guard folio. Difficult to read as the folio is turned dark and the black ink is bit spreaded. There are three lines the possible transcription is as follows- 1 śrīmu.....grāmavasina 2 bhāradvājagotra..... ...... 3 ritivibhāvana

listBibl.bibl: Grantharatnamālā. [1] Mumbai : Gopāḷa Nārāyaṇa, s.d.[1887?]. The information of the publication is accessed on Worldcat org.

encodingDesc.p: Dots are used to show progression of the text.

TEI.text:
[1v 1] śrīmate hayagrīvāya namaḥ avyādavyājabhaktipracayaparicayasphītavijñānasaṃpatsaṃpannānandasāndrāmṛtaśiśirasvāntasiṃhāsanāgre kṛ [1v 2] tvā rāmāṅghriyugmaṃ kimapi bharatavatsārvabhaumpraśastiṃ prāpyāpaśadraghūṇāṃ paribṛḍhamapiyassoyamasmadgururnaḥ durlabhañjayati deśi [1v 3] kavaryānmantra (2 letters are struckthrough) matulaṃ mama labdhaṃ karṇagaṃ yadadhīkāśī mumukṣoścārukalpayati candravataṃsaḥ ..śrībhojalakmaṇasudhī bhukte prabandhe
[28v 5] ….. vaidehimupalālayannijaguṇaiḥ siṃhāsanādhyāsitassauṃdaryai sataniṣe [28v 6] vito vijayate sāmrājyalkṣīsakhaḥ vāghūlānvayasindhuśritiśraṇaḥ vidvajjanāgraślāghitānmānyāyāmiha veṅkaṭādrividuṣo maṅgambimāyāṃ gu [28v 7] ṇaiḥ saṃjāte na vidarbhalakṣmaṇakṛte caṃpuprabaṃdhe kṛtaḥ kāṇḍo veṅkaṭadhvarīya viduṣā jīyācciraṃ saptamaḥ [29r 1] prajokva(4 letters broken due to wormeaten.) kṛṣradvitīyāyāṃ vidhyordine śeṣādrāhvayadāsena ??tticaṃpussamāpītam hariḥ oṃ [29r 2] bhāradvājāncayokṛti na veṃkaṭārryasutanuśeṣādryāhvaya dāsena granthoyaṃ likhitaḥ kramāt. hariḥ oṃ
